strapiEdition.headline: Guiton Likely Joining the Razorback Family

sponsor.partnerMessage:
There is certainly no shortage of perks when it comes to living in NWA. From miles of biking trails, to world class art museums, lakes and innovative dining, NWA offers something for everyone. Don’t love where you live? Let’s talk!

Esther Graves NWA | REALTORⓇ

posts.title: Round Two of the Paycheck Protection Program
posts.content:
A second round issued for the Payment Protection Program to accompany your second vaccination.

  • The Economic Aid to Hard-Hit Small Businesses, Nonprofits, and Venues Act appropriated $325 billion to PPP and other related programs. This included $284.45 billion to providing eligible borrowers the opportunity to obtain a second round of PPP loan funding (“PPP Second Round”).
  • Attention Small Businesses - As long as you have no more than 300 employees AND have suffered 25% or more reduction in gross revenues between comparable quarters in 2019 and 2020 then you are eligible for your second dose.
  • More information about about the types of forgiveness and whether you qualify can be found HERE.

posts.title: More NWA Students Prefer In-Person Learning Over Virtual Classrooms
posts.content:
Bentonville and Springdale school districts are seeing shift to in-person learning as students head back to school this semester.

  • Around 250 students (or likely their parents) made the decision to switch from virtual learning to in-person instruction for the 2021 Spring Semester, says Rick Shaeffer with Springdale SD. Overall, Shaeffer says parents are feeling safer and more confident in the schools as Covid numbers have stayed relatively constant
  • Springdale schools kicked off the year Monday, while students in the Bentonville SD are starting in-person classes on Wednesday. More information about different approaches schools are taking can be found HERE

posts.title: Kenny Guiton - Welcome to the Razorback Family (almost)
posts.content:
Sources indicate Kenny Guiton will likely join Sam Pittman's coaching staff as Justin Stepp leaves for South Carolina.

  • Hailing from Colorado State, the former Ohio State quarterback began his career as wide receivers coach in his hometown of Houston. He helped lead the Cougars to a 13-1 record in 2015 and a 9-4 record in 2016. Following Houston he took his talents to Louisiana Tech (2019).
  • In Guiton's glory days, he was Ohio State's team captain from 2012-2013. And yes, he beat us in the Sugar Bowl 2011 that we'd all like to forget...

ICYMI - Arkansas linebacker Grant Morgan was a top three finalist for the Burlsworth Trophy. Kudos to you sir, we look forward to next year!

posts.title: NWA Businesses Fail ABC COVID-19 Regulations
posts.content:
Several NWA bars and restaurants have failed to enforce the state's COVID-19 regulations.

  • The Arkansas Beverage Control conducted Covid compliance checks across the state between Monday, Dec. 28, and Jan. 3. The ABC found many of the local bars and restaurants were not enforcing social distancing or were serving drinks past the 11 p.m. cutoff. The full list of violators can be found HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Winter glow: The Momentary in Bentonville is hosting a pop-up outdoor experience featuring the RODE Bar, crafted brews, smores, and more.
  • Covid Check: This week, the U of A will have a drive through Covid check. Student's, Faculty, and Staff are strongly encouraged to have a Q-tip inserted.
  • East Fayetteville folks: Moms, the City heard you. Gully Park parking lot is being expanded.
  • Work with us: We want to feature your business! Explore our advertising options on our website.
